title: How to Do Anti Cellulite Massage

steps.headline: Apply moisturizing lotion to the cellulite ridden area so your hands glide on with ease.
Start massaging at the lowest point and go up towards your heart.
Apply moderate pressure to the skin and alternate these moves:
Always finish off with some relaxing broad contact strokes (Effleurage)

text:
Apply moisturizing lotion to the cellulite ridden area so your hands glide on with ease. Start massaging at the lowest point and go up towards your heart. Apply moderate pressure to the skin and alternate these moves: Long sweeping strokes using your knuckles, fingers or palm of your hand. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Circular motion again using your hand as above. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Kneading motion by grasping your skin with your thumb and fingers and massaging it in circular motion like it was dough. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pinch the skin gently between thumb and fingers and pull it slightly away from the body. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pinch the skin gently between thumb and fingers and gently pull it in all directions. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Do-Anti-Cellulite-Massage-Step-3Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Always finish off with some relaxing broad contact strokes (Effleurage)
sentences: Apply moisturizing lotion to the cellulite ridden area so your hands glide on with ease.
Start massaging at the lowest point and go up towards your heart.
Apply moderate pressure to the skin and alternate these moves: Long sweeping strokes using your knuckles, fingers or palm of your hand.
